message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.LG. 

The paper focuses on language-guided perception for mobile manipulators, which is a topic that falls under the robotics (cs.RO) sub-category. The use of language to guide perception involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, which are part of the computational linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel extension of symbolic representations for language-guided perception, which involves reasoning and inference, falling under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The perception pipeline involves object detection, which is a computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Finally, the paper explores the differences in performance between adaptive perception and a suitable baseline, which involves machine learning (cs.LG) techniques.
